comments.body:
This can already be done with the hoppers(can't move upwards though) themselves but I agree it is a little weird. Pipes would make them look cleaner and would be more intuitive for new players.

I think they should basically work the same way as the hopper, transfering items from one side to the other and being a storage unit by itself, but can't have items thrown/dropped in them. You would craft them just like the hopper but without the last ingot at the bottom.
I love this idea. I hate in bedrock edition i cant get items to move upwards in a small space.
They should be made of copper, the new ore for the Caves and Cliffs update.
This could go great with the new copper ore

If it was made to be essentially like a hopper, but with only one input and output (unless L junctions or T junctions are made). This would be a great use for the new ore and it could help with lag from entities or hopper checks but would still allow players to move items. It could connect between hoppers to droppers, dispensers, or to other hoppers and would probably make building farms more compact and more intuitive to look at.
yeah these could be used with hoppers the hoppers would collect the item and the pipe would transfer it

I agree, it will optimize the hopper issue quite a lot, and water despawning issues. They will need hoppers at the end. They could pass a redstone signal to a comparator when they have things passing through. Visually they could have some variations , wooden, copper, stone. They could also be filled with water or transport liquids, including lava with obsidian pipes ... time for a shower.

Yes please! Use copper ingots to make copper pipes, attach to bottom of hopper, from there it can continue down or sideways, and can eventually be changed to an upward direction if desired! Transferring items up has always been an awkward issue with hoppers, and creating a line of hoppers to transfer items sideways or down is a huge waste of iron IMHO, but copper is ridiculously common and has not many uses. Copper pipes for the win!!!

I think it would be good to have two pieces, a pipe with one input and output which connect end to end only (like repeaters), and a junction which connects pipes and could have up to 7 inputs and one output. This way you could have parallels pipes without the priority connecting issue that rails have.
But for items could have a "aspiration chest" and pull items inside

Actually, the pumpkin pie recipe is egg, sugar, pumpkin, so I think we should stick to that for other pie flavors.

Also, melon pie?

Maybe to balance it even further, Piglin Brutes might start attacking you from an even greater distance if you're wearing it, sensing that you, the player, stole it from one of their kind. Meanwhile, regular Piglins wouldn't be smart enough to realize this and would instead respect the player, like you said.
It's a very good idea, but the bracelet can slightly lessen the damage that Piglin Brute does.
Me gusta la idea  yme gustaria que al  estar equipado el brazalete nos brindará protección contra el fuego
That is a really cool idea but with nether gold being added wouldn’t it be a good idea for it to be crafted from that?

How about it having another use of it would be blocking all melee weapon damage for five times of usage leaving it useless after the fifth use other then Being protection from piglin agro with a depleted usage bar like elytra till you repair it with golden nuggets.
Or maybe it should also decrease 50% damage and have a chance to stun mobs that hit you because there should be more rewards for killing a hostile mob with 50 health (25 hearts).
Fair
Makes sense, I always felt like it took too long to eat berries. It shouldn't take that long, honestly.
This would help berries be a much better early game food source
But there are so many seeds in them, and if you don't chew them all and eat too many you'll get appendicitis.
Dried Kelp works like this, it takes a really short time to eat them.
That and cookies maybe

Yes, and it should be applied to cookies and other "little" food. The idea of don't interrupt sprinting when eating fast-eating food it's pretty cool and could be better than just "2 hunger points full-time food is now 1 hunger point half-time food"
Ooo. i think if it had another use as well, it would be great. we need a few more nether crops, like netherwart.

Interesting but personally the whole soul sand valley vibe with the crying ghasts and skeletons gives me a deathly feeling. Maybe soul plants/seeds aren't the best idea for this biome since it runs contrary to the atmosphere.
Just make it Warped Wart
Well maybe they are undead plants? Haha
Yes! Black wood! That would be amazing to add in the Savannah biome.

I'm not sure about the toxic stuff, but I was about to post this one until I saw yours:

An idea I had for Minecraft is maybe adding rare trees like black ebony.

Since wood like this is, expensive, rare, hard to grow, endangered to some extent, and in some cases nationally protected because it's scarce- I think it would be cool to introduce it.

Similar to how there's a payoff to having aged copper, there could be rare endangered trees that take as long to grow as it takes copper to turn green.

This would give players a challenge to find and grow these trees but also cultivate the importance of tree farming and creating natural habitats to protect them.

Just an idea!

There are SO many types of black stone now especially with the addition of all the Deepslate variations. We really need a darker wood to complement and expand the palette. Dark Oak doors seem to look too bright now in comparison.
We need something other than acacia trees to break up the monotony of the savannas. Ebony sounds like a good idea. Maximum contrast for those glowing white and yellow text signs!
Yes I need black floorboards !!
Would be an interesting mechanic and a big change too what can be done in the Nether
That is a very interesting idea as I have been wanting a block or item that allows water placement, what would the radius be. Like 3 source blocks in a 9 by 9 area?
That is a very cool mechanic. It would be nice of water couldn't flow out of conduit radius. =)
Heck yeah, dude. A clever way to implement the ability to place water in the Nether, and just a clever idea overall.
Very nice suggestion. It would reward Nether-based builders greatly.
I was about to make another post entailing the exact same thing. I love the idea of being able to conquer the nether through terraforming. This truly makes base building possible in the nether.
Any further suggestions (suggestions on fruits possibly) will be appreciated.
Not a BAD idea, but I think Mojang is too busy with the 1.16 update and the biome one to have the time to do this. Nevertheless, excellent idea
I know this is way out of topic but there should be fruit in sandwiches! Or smoothies! But either way still add MORE fruit
Bowl, Apple, Melon, Sweet Berries, Glow Berries and Sugar/Honey I feel would be a nice crafting recipe for a Fruit Salad. Any additional fruit added into the game could also contribute to the recipe.

i would like to add a vegtables update like to add more stuff like bannanas and coconuts and tomatos and all other stuff and fruits like ananas lemon and orange and strawberrys and blueberrys and that plus i would like to add bag of chips or bag of popcorn and corn and others! pls add this it will be lots of fun!

Good idea!

Some fruit could be lemons, limes, oranges and maybe grapefruit. They seem like things that might grow on trees

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.
Great idea and art, I like that idea of them folding up at night, but perhaps they emit a light level of 2? Maybe just finding them at night lightly glowing is kinda alluring to me.
This sounds really fun, I love the novelty of this idea.
Excellent idea that would make jungles beautiful! Also see this complementary suggestion.
cool idea but there is so many posts about light that can be held in your hand. expand on the post... ad a description of the crafting recipe. that will give Mojang a better view of the idea.
think this is a bit too modern. dynamic lighting would be a better. hold lighted object in hand, have light.
The reason I say flashlight, is because apparent people believe Minecraft isnt allowed to put in a way for torches to light up in your hand.
Support, but I want a nerf. Two nerf suggestions: 1. This item has limited durability. 2. You can't use this item and a weapon simultaneously.
Like the idea but I feel like it need a craft recipe and all is great because it could add to horror maps and such

how about

crafting recipe;

  • flashlight: 2 torches, 1 glass pane, 2 iron ingots (cannot switch off, lasts for 2 minecraft days, can repair with 2 torches)
  • redstone flashlight: 2 redstone torches, 1 glass, 2 iron ingots, 1 stone button (can switch off, can switch off, lasts for 6 minecraft days, works forever)

benefits: can hold in your off-hand, helps with blindness, say goodbye to placing torches

problems: attracts mobs!

reverse flashlight: 1 redstone flashlight and 8 amethyst geodes (repels every single mob, works forever)

(can also be placed!)

Amaizing for deep dark. It should involve copper ingot and amethyst shards to craft. It will consume redstone dustp right from inventory to work (like batteries). Great way to utilize excessive redstone for those players who dont build mechanisms. It is not mean to replace torches (because it consumes redstone at fast rate), but to act as portable source of light in tought situations (like escaping from Warden). It should blink everytime new redstone dust item is loaded - to notify player.

Copper, redstone, amethist are all avalible on caves. Would be great yo have more crafting recepies involving them

I fully agree, and if it was in the tools tab we could have batteries included (which could open alot of possible ideas) and when you turn it on it uses 1 damage and when you either switch off of it or put it in a chest it turns it off, and batteries could be made with redstone dust, iron nugget, and gold nugget

genius! that would solve so many problems. also, how about placing vines in the nether to slowly dry them, as an alternative to cooking them in a furnace. so the player can choose between fast but expensive, or cheap but risky.

I love the idea of them turning into dead vines in the nether.  It might even allow the farming of them if it happens slowly, since you could place living vines, allow them to grow, and have them randomly die.
my original idea was for it to dry up in desserts, but i know that some people like to add a bit of life in dessert builds.
Genius, and good add a lot of cool looks to dungeons
Yes yes yes we need this

I agree! I’d love to be able to put a book on a nightstand or a carrot on a kitchen counter. The possibilities are endless! However, to make this a better fit for vanilla Minecraft, perhaps slime balls can be applied as “glue” to a surface of a block, and then an item could be placed on it just like an item frame. If you break it, it would act like red stone just popping off the red stone dust.
I would love it to be added as a builder I want the ability to place items on the ground without the item frame

Honestly I feel like it shouldn't be Craftable. But my idea is that the wandering trader should have it as an unlocked trade! Because he can turn himself invisible, what if he had a way of crafting them for you. I feel like its a more vanilla idea! Plus honestly right now he's just for the free leads lol..

I mean that would be cool but then again the downside to that would be that you wouldn't be able to create a chest with mixed woods anymore which can be a big downside for speedrunners and others. But yea I guess it would be cool.
I'd go a step further and make the nether 1s hold less but be the only 1s which can't burn, but that might be too punishing so no double chests could be a more reasonable idea
Chests are already fire proof.
I like it
Different chests for all woodtypes but also a "patchwork" chest that can be made from any combination of planks would work I think.
This is a feature I personally think really should be added to Minecraft. The chests are kind of boring texture-wise and this would add a whole new pop to the game!

More container options would be great.
They could even add a unique look for an oak chest and have the current one (for posterity/backwards compatibility) if you use mixed woods to create it.
This was going to be a thing, until the Swamps lost the biome vote...
its a good idea because if your going fishing but your inventory's full just put some items in the chest and then when you catch a fish you could put it in the chest.

This could add some more appeal to fishing and using boats, which is always a good thing to encourage using less used items. It could be like minecarts, and there could even possibly be a furnace boat which works like a motorized boat.
This this idea will already happen sometime in the future, since it was featured in the biome vote.
Super Idee brauche es unbedingt für Expeditionen
This Is Good Idea :D
Agree. i want this the most

Yes!!! Mojang. please add polished andesite, diorite and granite walls. You have the raw varieties of the 3, but have both for blackstone. You even gave polished blackstone buttons and pressure plates. Please be more consistent. I'm not asking for vertical slabs (although they would be nice) or dirt slabs.

I wholeheartedly agree!

I would add prismarine bricks walls to this list

Please this, there is such a lack of walls in the game, way less than there are slabs, stairs, ect. Blackstone and Deepslate got all their variants into walls, and yet not the same can be said for older materials, it would add a lot of variety to builds.
anything that can be considered stone should have wall variants imo. I'd also love wooden walls because they would look different to fences and gates.
I would love to see wooden walls be added to the game
Why not add even more mob heads? I think one should be dropped when a mob is killed by a charged creeper.

Yeah i think this is a good idea because just the basic heads (other than the wither and dragon). I think they should be in the game also because I’m a massive fan of the pillager and with a pillager head makes me very happy (and i made a comment on how the warden head shouldn’t be in the game and i now take that back i think its a great idea)

I think azalea trees should have their own wood type. Currently, they replace oak trees, and I think that azaleas are merely deformed oak trees with flowers. Also, azaleas in real life are able to grow in low light, and are shade tolerant. I think they can grow in dark oak forests, where there is less light.
I get the Idea but Azaleas are real plants and have a pinkish wood, it wouldn't make sense to have all the other trees accurate to their actual plant and not the Azalea.
I think this is smart but knowing that striders are already in the game, I’m not sure the will make boats.
Striders exist as Lava boats and Nether horses.
I voted 'cause when I played Nether survival and finally made it out from the Nether I was in the middle of the ocean and had no means to travel on the water, cause nether-wood boats don't exist.

I was disappointed when I discovered nether boats hadn't come with the 1.16 update, and I hope they add them soon. Since you can't smelt nether wood in a furnace, it would also make sense if the nether boats were resistant to lava, allowing you to cross lava using a boat made of nether wood
I was just staring out into the open in the nether and thought that there needs to be nether boats so traveling is easier.
Nether boats could also be upgraded from normal boats with a netherite ingot. They should float on lava, but sink in normal water.

Nether boats could be part of a whole lava update that could include lava fishing, too! Think about it -- the Nether update updated most parts of the Nether but the ONLY thing it added to lava oceans was striders. Lava oceans need more. They need nether wood boats, and some kind of vegetation growing in them, and some kind of fish, and more kinds of lava sea life, parallel to all the different kinds of life in the overworld oceans.

Nether Boat drown in water.
Nether Planks are made of mushrooms

This one kinda seems a little obvious, I'm surprised it didn't happen.
dose anyone remember using pigs? Am I the only one?

I think this is a great idea but i think the nether boats should be slower in lava because lava is stickier you can see that because it flows much more slowly than water. I also think that nether boats would sink in lava. just an idea
Regardless of practicality (due to striders,) I think it'd be a nice touch of extra color and attention to detail in the game.
Yes, and it would be amazing to have some new bright colored boats.
I really like the effect of the soul blossom. If the player goes to the nether and finds a soul blossom, it could be a sign that there are or there may be mobs around. Nice idea!
Making mob spawning a potion effect is not a good idea. Neither is flowers in the nether

I like the idea, but the potion effect doesn't fit in my opinion. Maybe if the soul blossom was present in an area, then that area would have increased mob spawning. I'm not all on par with that idea, but maybe this flower could be used to brew potions of nausea?
How you make that?
Pretty good idea
It would be super cool if we could right-click a Noteblock with a Clock item to change the duration of the note.
For some sounds (blocks under the noteblock) it could just be that the note plays as long as the block is powered.
Great suggestion. Would completely change the world of note block creations.
Typically having a bit of extra timing after the noteblock does the trick of having that effect.
Sustain could be tied to how long the redstone signal is on, and volume could be tied to redstone strength.
Yeah, the best way to do this would be to make note blocks sustained via continuous redstone power, with the loudness directly proportional to the strength of the signal.
Maybe a different texture then the normal grindstone, like the stone part of the block, is replaced with Blackstone! Cool idea! :D
Well if Blackstone can craft Cobblestone stuff and a grindstone is crafted with stone slabs, maybe polished blackstone slabs?

If there is a way to make a grindstone with Blackstone you can unenchant soul speed books for a expensive but nether exclusive way of making an enchantment table and book shelves Wich I would love to be in the game!

Yes please!!! I am currently playing a Nether only survival with the goal to kill the Wither, it is going to be hard (hard mode) without enchantments. The only source of a normal book is to disenchant an enchanted book (e.g. soul speed) for an enchanting table via the grindstone.

Anyone know of a method of getting cobblestone/stone in the Nether?
oh god I can't wait for this someone make a datapack I've already installed craftable elytra
I am all for this but keep in mind boys: Where we gonna get lapis in the Nether?
Or it could be cheaper
or maybe the fletching tables the only way you could be make arrows with special effects
Maybe instead of getting xp from crafting, it works similar to the stonecutter. Either way I think this is an interesting idea

Maybe instead of xp cause that could be OP, It could give you more arrow/rockets per craft so if you make arrows you get 6 instead or 3 or with rockets you get 4 maybe 5 rockets per craft instead of 3
Actually i wrote wrong, the title is fletching table use. and is every time not every them.

I think fletching table using must be like loom.We but the small box in the fletching table and we put other box creeper head or any firework design and put the bottom box a dye and It is give a firework that we designed firework.Or Fletching table using the simple arrow maker

Not sure about the “gaining experience” part of this, but using the fletching table as a UI dedicated to firework creation would be cool. It could help enumerate all the different shape, color, and other modifiers (similarly to how the loom enumerates the possible banner patterns). I’m not sure how the crafting ingredients like gold nuggets, diamonds, and fire charges would be consumed when crafting firework charge special effects - perhaps a running tally could be kept for the expenses of the rocket, and a small amount of interface inventory spaces could be used to deposit the materials, similar to a beacon?
400985099571 or u can get one more arrow per crafting.
it is a interesting idea, using it will amazing.
But fletching tables have nothing to do with fireworks, they're related to bows and arrows.

There should be functionality to create different types of arrows.
For example, with iron and copper tips; whistling (special) arrows, reusable hunting arrows.
I agree and the use of bone meal on them should grow the respective mushrooms.
Also both Nylium blocks should spread. At a slower rate than grass but make warped nylium faster than crimson to show its parasitic tendency to grow faster than then crimson.
Another idea: right click on nylium with a shovel to turn it into Nylium Path.
That is a cool idea! It reminds me a bit of my ointment post, but it has a different type of power that makes it unique and interesting. I would love to see enemies with this kind of effect on them!
That tree looks Awesome!!!
Buena idea
Great ideia.This comes with new planks and others variants.

A unique and beautiful tree that can add more interest to exploration, building, and decoration.

Perhaps the bark can be sheared to obtain a carpet or painting type item which when placed shows one of several rainbow patterns.
Coolest tree ever, new BIOME! Rainbow koalas!
